description:
8.54 ashowinfo
Show a line containing various information for each input audio frame.
The input audio is not modified.

The shown line contains a sequence of key/value pairs of the form
key:value.

The following values are shown in the output:

checksum.description: The Adler-32 checksum (printed in hexadecimal) of the audio data. For planar audio, the data is treated as if all the planes were concatenated.

n.description: The (sequential) number of the input frame, starting from 0.

nb_samples.description: The number of samples (per channel) in the frame.

plane_checksums.description: A list of Adler-32 checksums for each data plane.

pts.description: The presentation timestamp of the input frame, in time base units; the time base depends on the filter input pad, and is usually 1/sample_rate.

pts_time.description: The presentation timestamp of the input frame in seconds.

rate.description: The sample rate for the audio frame.

name: ashowinfo

parameters.description: The (sequential) number of the input frame, starting from 0.
parameters.name: n

parameters.description: The presentation timestamp of the input frame, in time base units; the time base depends on the filter input pad, and is usually 1/sample_rate.
parameters.name: pts

parameters.description: The presentation timestamp of the input frame in seconds.
parameters.name: pts_time

parameters.description: The sample rate for the audio frame.
parameters.name: rate

parameters.description: The number of samples (per channel) in the frame.
parameters.name: nb_samples

parameters.description: The Adler-32 checksum (printed in hexadecimal) of the audio data. For planar audio, the data is treated as if all the planes were concatenated.
parameters.name: checksum

parameters.description: A list of Adler-32 checksums for each data plane.
parameters.name: plane_checksums

source:
8.54 ashowinfo

Show a line containing various information for each input audio frame. The input audio is not modified.

The shown line contains a sequence of key/value pairs of the form key:value.

The following values are shown in the output:

n

The (sequential) number of the input frame, starting from 0.

pts

The presentation timestamp of the input frame, in time base units; the time base depends on the filter input pad, and is usually 1/sample_rate.

pts_time

The presentation timestamp of the input frame in seconds.

fmt

The sample format.

chlayout

The channel layout.

rate

The sample rate for the audio frame.

nb_samples

The number of samples (per channel) in the frame.

checksum

The Adler-32 checksum (printed in hexadecimal) of the audio data. For planar audio, the data is treated as if all the planes were concatenated.

plane_checksums

A list of Adler-32 checksums for each data plane.
